column4: Hi All, I've got a quick question... perhaps a general one...
I've got a .deb file for something I want to install, but I don't know how to install it.
sudo dpkg -i package
thx!
why not just use apt-get for the gimp?
I think whomever built the .deb named it wrong... where did I find this thing... ./?
do : sudo apt-get install gimp
though check it isn't already isntalled... Ubuntu comes with the Gimp installed as default :)
this is just a frontend for the gimp, and I think the .deb I was trying to get might be named incorrectly
where did you download it from?
it's mentioned on slashdot
got that gimp deb package from http://cmb.phys.cwru.edu/kisner/gimpshop/
did you try redownloading it? sometimes files become corrupt when you download
yeah, that must be it..  ... I do want to try this out before adobe sues the developers into pulling this package
if you want to use amsn and mplayer, I suggest you get them sooner rather than later

thx for the tip. http://codemills.com/blog/?p=4 is the site with the linux version of gimpshop. He says he's gonna compile an official .deb for it...  He's updated the site in the past few hours, so I think he'll have somethi8ng more ubuntu friendly in the next few hours
It skins GIMP to look like photoshop... which, for me would be very, very helpful.. and ensure I use my linux box more.

Yeah, honestly, I've made the adjustment to gnome... my 1st linux install was frickin gentoo (like ubuntu/synaptic much better) so i'm used to jumping in headfirst... but I really go back a long way with photoshop...
yeah gentoo isn't exacrtly newbie friendly :)
A fact they'll gladly point out on their user forums instaed of answering specific questions.
how do you mean?
Gentoo forums != helpful
